speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: SCENE IV. Another part of the field.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Alarum: excursions. Enter NORFOLK and forces fighting; to him CATESBY

speaker: CATESBY
text_entry: Rescue, my Lord of Norfolk, rescue, rescue!

speaker: CATESBY
text_entry: The king enacts more wonders than a man,

speaker: CATESBY
text_entry: Daring an opposite to every danger:

speaker: CATESBY
text_entry: His horse is slain, and all on foot he fights,

speaker: CATESBY
text_entry: Seeking for Richmond in the throat of death.

speaker: CATESBY
text_entry: Rescue, fair lord, or else the day is lost!

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: A horse! a horse! my kingdom for a horse!

speaker: CATESBY
text_entry: Withdraw, my lord; I'll help you to a horse.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Slave, I have set my life upon a cast,

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: And I will stand the hazard of the die:

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: I think there be six Richmonds in the field;

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: Five have I slain to-day instead of him.

speaker: KING RICHARD III
text_entry: A horse! a horse! my kingdom for a horse!
